task.title: How to change your PID password
task.shortdesc: Students, faculty and staff must change their PID password before July 1, 2011. Users who have not changed their password by July 1, 2011 will be not be able to log in until they have changed their password. The new password will be valid for 12 months from the date of the change.

context.p: This article applies to those users who know their current PID password and want to change it. If you have forgotten your password, call 4Help at (540) 231-HELP (4357) to have it reset. For more information, see Changing Your Forgotten PID Password

step.cmd: Go to the My VT website
Click the Log On with CAS button
In the Username text box, type your Virginia Tech PID
In the Password text box, type your current PID password

step.info: If you want to be warned when you are being logged on to another Virginia Tech service automatically, place a check in the Warn before logging into other sites check box. You must place a check in this check box each time you log on to My VT

step.cmd: Select the Personal Info tab Screen shot of Personal Info tab
Under Contact Info, click the Manage Your Profile link Screen shot of Manage your profile link
Under General Information, click the Change Password link Screen shot of Change Password link

step.info: Refer to Creating Strong Passwords for information on creating a strong password

step.cmd: In the Current Password text box, type the password you want to change
In the New Password text box, type your new password
In the New Password Again text box, retype your new password
Click the Change Password button Screen shot of Change Password button
Click the Log Off link Screen shot of Log Off link
For increased security, close your browser.
step.info: Since many online services, such as e-mail, My VT, and Hokie SPA, require using your PID to log on, you will need to use your new password when logging on to these services.

taskbody.postreq: If for any reason students have a Hokies ID or an Oracle ID, then they will be required to change those passwords as well.
